intro: Deroemera triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, similar to other members of the family, and it often grows in rocky or sandy soils. Deroemera triloba is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
